title: Question 1
question: Detecting a change in hospital infection rates" is a scenario of Conversational Al.
explanation_en: Detecting a change in hospital infection rates is an analytics or anomaly-detection scenario, not a conversational AI scenario. Conversational AI covers systems that hold a dialog with users, such as chatbots or voice agents. Here you are analysing numeric data over time, not engaging in conversation.

title: Question 2
question: You are testing a machine learning model. How should you split data for training and evaluation?

options.label: A
options.text: Use features for training and labels for evaluation.

options.label: B
options.text: Randomly split the data into some rows for training and remaining rows for evaluation.

options.label: C
options.text: Use labels for training and features for evaluation.

options.label: D
options.text: Randomly split the data into columns for training and columns for evaluation.

explanation_en: To evaluate a machine learning model fairly you must test it on examples it has not seen during training. The typical approach is to randomly split the rows of your dataset into a training set and a separate evaluation set. Using features vs. labels for training/evaluation or splitting by columns would break the learning process.

title: Question 3
question:
Drag and Drop the Microsoft guiding principles for responsible Al (on the left) to the appropriate description
        (on the right)
explanation_en: The Microsoft guiding principles for responsible AI are Fairness, Reliability & Safety, Privacy & Security, Inclusiveness, Transparency, and Accountability. Each description in the question should be matched to one of these principles, for example, avoiding discrimination relates to Fairness, protecting personal data to Privacy & Security, and making systems understandable to Transparency.

title: Question 4
question:
Your team member is planning to use the Form Recognizer pre-built receipt model.
        Which kind of Azure resource should you recommend to create?
explanation_en: The prebuilt receipt model is part of Azure AI Document Intelligence, previously known as Form Recognizer. To use this model you must create a Form Recognizer (Document Intelligence) resource, not a Face or Computer Vision resource. That resource exposes the receipt endpoint that extracts key fields such as merchant, date, and totals from receipts.

title: Question 5
question:
You are developing a system, that scans the news for articles about your customers and alert employees
        when there is a negative article. Positive articles must be added to a press book. Which natural language processing tasks should you use to complete the process?
explanation_en: The scenario has two tasks: finding mentions of your company in text and determining whether the news is positive or negative. Named Entity Recognition finds entities such as organization names in text, while Sentiment Analysis scores the overall attitude of the text as positive, neutral, or negative. Key phrase extraction and translation do not directly address these goals.

title: Question 6
question: Select the correct use case from provided scenarios for classification?

options.label: A
options.text: predicting how many cups of coffee a person will drink based on how many hours the

options.label: B
options.text: predicting how many minutes it will take someone to run a race based on past race times.

options.label: C
options.text: predicting whether someone uses a bicycle to travel to work based on the distance from

options.label: D
options.text: analyzing the contents of images and grouping images that have similar colors.

explanation_en: Classification problems predict a discrete label such as yes/no or a category. Predicting whether someone uses a bicycle to travel to work is a yes/no decision based on features like distance, so it is a classification task. Predicting a number such as minutes of travel or cups of coffee is regression, and grouping similar items without labels is clustering.

title: Question 7
question: Which Azure OpenAl model can generate original images from natural language?
explanation_en: DALL-E (and its successor GPT-image-1 in Azure) is the model designed to generate original images from natural language prompts. Whisper is used for speech-to-text, embeddings models create vector representations of text, and GPT-3.5/4 are primarily text and code models. Therefore only DALL-E fits the requirement of image generation from text.

title: Question 8
question:
You have a dataset. You need to build an Azure Machine Learning classification model that will identify
        defective products. What should you do first?

options.label: B
options.text: Split the data into training and testing datasets.

explanation_en: Before you can configure training you must first load your dataset into Azure Machine Learning. Once the data is available in the workspace or Designer, you can split it into training and test subsets, choose algorithms, and start training runs. Without loading data, none of the later steps are possible.

title: Question 9
question:
You are developing an Al system and encountered a situation where the Al system should be ingested with
        unusual and missing values.
        Which Microsoft guiding principle for responsible Al you should consider?
explanation_en: Reliability and Safety focus on ensuring that AI systems behave safely and predictably, especially under unusual conditions such as missing or abnormal input data. In such cases the system may need to refuse to return a prediction or trigger additional checks rather than silently producing unreliable output. That is exactly the concern described in the scenario.

title: Question 10
question:
What are the various possible channels, a bot can be connected to?
        Select all correct options.
explanation_en: A bot built with Azure Bot Service can be connected to many different channels, such as Microsoft Teams, email, web chat on a website, and even voice assistants or telephony like Alexa via appropriate connectors. The core bot logic is reused while Bot Service handles the channel integration. Therefore all of the listed channels are valid examples.

title: Question 11
question: Match the Microsoft guidance for responsible generative Al stages with their appropriate definition.
explanation_en: Microsoft’s responsible generative AI process can be summarised as Identify, Measure, Mitigate, and Operate. You first identify potential harms and risks, then measure how often they occur, apply mitigations such as filters or data changes, and finally operate the system with ongoing monitoring and governance. The definitions in the question map to these four stages.

title: Question 12
question:
You have a frequently asked questions (FAQ) PDF file and need to create a conversational support system
        based on the FAQ.
        Which service should you use?
explanation_en: If you have an FAQ document and want a chatbot to answer questions with predefined answers, the classic Azure service is QnA Maker, now the Question Answering feature of Azure AI Language. It ingests a PDF or web page, builds a knowledge base of question–answer pairs, and exposes it via an API that a bot can call. Computer Vision or Form Recognizer process documents, but they do not provide a Q&A experience by themselves.

title: Question 13
question: Answering frequently asked questions" is a scenario of Conversational Al.
explanation_en: Answering frequently asked questions in natural language is one of the most common Conversational AI scenarios. A user asks a question through chat or voice, and a bot or copilot responds with an appropriate answer. That is exactly what FAQ bots built with Azure Bot Service, Copilot Studio, or Azure AI Language are designed to do.

title: Question 14
question:
Extracting key insights from structured and unstructured data sources is a feature of what type of
        workload?
        Select the correct option.
explanation_en: Knowledge mining is the workload focused on extracting insights from large volumes of structured and unstructured data. Solutions are typically built with Azure AI Search and cognitive skills to pull key information, entities, and relationships out of documents and databases. Computer vision, NLP, and other services can be used inside a knowledge-mining pipeline, but the overall scenario described matches knowledge mining.

title: Question 15
question:
You have an Azure Machine Learning pipeline that contains a Split Data module. The Split Data module
        outputs to a Train Model module and a Score Model module.
        What is the function of the Split Data module?

options.label: A
options.text: Selecting columns that must be included in the model.

options.label: B
options.text: Scaling numeric variables so that they are within a consistent numeric range.

options.label: D
options.text: Diverting records that have missing data.

explanation_en: In Azure Machine Learning designer, the Split Data component is used to divide your dataset into subsets, most commonly a training set and a validation or test set. This allows you to train the model on one subset and evaluate its performance on a separate subset. It does not normalise features, select algorithms, or evaluate the model directly.

title: Question 16
question:
You need to reduce the load on telephone operators by implementing a chatbot to answer simple questions
        with predefined answers.
        Which two Al service should you use to achieve the goal?
explanation_en: To reduce the load on telephone operators with a simple FAQ-style chatbot, you typically combine Azure Bot Service with QnA Maker (Question Answering in Azure AI Language). Azure Bot Service hosts the bot and connects it to channels like web chat or telephony, while QnA Maker provides the knowledge base of predefined questions and answers. Form Recognizer and Computer Vision are not designed for FAQ chat.

title: Question 17
question:
Which statement is an example of a Microsoft responsible Al principle?
        Select the correct option.

options.label: A
options.text: Al systems must be transparent and inclusive.

options.label: B
options.text: Al systems must use only publicly available data.

options.label: C
options.text: Al systems must protect the interests of the company.

options.label: D
options.text: Al systems must keep personal details public.

explanation_en: Two of Microsoft’s responsible AI principles are Transparency and Inclusiveness. Transparency means that users can understand how the system works, what data it uses, and what its limitations are. Inclusiveness means designing AI to empower and include people with diverse abilities and backgrounds, rather than excluding them.

title: Question 18
question:
What can be used to build no-code apps that use built-in natural language processing models.
        Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.
explanation_en: Microsoft Copilot Studio is a no-code or low-code tool for building conversational apps that use built-in natural language processing models. It allows you to define topics, intents, and responses visually without writing code, and can connect to your data. Bot Framework is a code-first SDK, and Azure Health Bot is a specialised medical scenario, not a general no-code NLP app builder.

title: Question 19
question:
Which Azure Cognitive Services service can be used to identify documents that contain sensitive
        information?
        Select the correct option.
explanation_en: Azure AI Document Intelligence (Form Recognizer) can analyse documents such as forms, invoices, and contracts, extract structured fields, and thus help you detect whether they contain sensitive information like names, addresses, or ID numbers. Custom Vision works on images for classification and object detection, and Conversational Language Understanding focuses on user utterances in dialogs, not full documents.

title: Question 20
question:
A banking system, that predicts whether a loan will be repaid or not, is an example of what type of machine
        learning?
        Select the correct option.
explanation_en: A system that predicts whether a loan will be repaid or not is performing a classification task because the output is a discrete label such as 'will default' or 'will be repaid'. Regression would predict a numeric value such as the exact loss amount, and clustering would group similar customers without pre-defined labels. Therefore classification is the correct type of machine learning.

question:

        Which type of Al workload should you use?

You are developing a mobile app for tourists, to scan and store their expenses while travelling.
        Which type of computer vision should you use?

title: Question 245
question:
"Predicting whether a person will develop mild, moderate or severe allergy symptoms based on pollen
        count" is an example of clustering.
        Select the correct option.

title: Question 246
question:
You have a large dataset that contains motor vehicle sales data.
        You need to train an automated machine learning (automated ML) model to predict vehicle sale values
        based on the type of vehicle.
        Which task should you select?

title: Question 247
question: Consider the scenario: An user is using an interactive application to get answers of his questions. Which Al service is used in above scenario?

title: Question 248
question:
You need to provide content for a business chatbot that will help answer simple user queries. Validate and
        confirm if the below solution can be used to create question and answer text by using QnA Maker? Connect the bot to the Cortana channel and ask questions by using Cortana. Select the correct option.

title: Question 249
question:
An Al solution that helps photographers to take better portrait photographs by providing feedback on
        exposure, noise, and occlusion is an example of _______
        Select the answer that correctly completes the sentence.

title: Question 250
question:
Your company manufactures widgets. You have 1,000 digital photos of the widgets and needs to identify
        the location of the widgets within the photos.
        What should you use?
